result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryen C. Knuth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Anything else out there
Consecutive to: Anything else out there.  The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation on this same case excluding the jail sentence.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  The defendant shall have no contact with Nellie Blackdeer of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant shall participate and comply with all requirements as ordered through applicable Children and Family Courts

timeConds.notes: Huber granted.  Defendant was granted 90 days credit for time served.
